course_title: Special Topics MESAS-300 Level: Slavery in the Lands of Islam
class_notes:
(Same as REL 370 1, HIST 396 1) Full topic:  Slavery in the Lands of Islam


Slavery existed in most societies and its eradication from our contemporary society continues to be our challenge and responsibility. This seminar course examines the institution of slavery in Islamic societies. It offers strong foundations to discuss slavery in the three main legal sources in Islam. This seminar will cover the most important aspects of slavery, including the geographical origins of the enslaved/captive population, their estimated numbers and demographics in Islamic lands, labor conditions, as well as production and reproduction characteristics. Through a thematic examination, we will analyze some of the most distinctive types of slavery that existed in different part of Islamic lands, such as military slavery, harem slavery, and eunuchs. We will be using primary source documents to cover some of the most characteristic aspects of slavery in Islam. Also, this seminar examines debates on the abolition of the institution of slavery By the end of the semester, the focus will be on the diaspora and the structural inequalities inherited from slavery and perpetuated to these days.
